intro: Casinga procera, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by distinctive, elongated fruits. Its roots and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their purported medicinal properties. The botanical features of Casinga procera make it an important species in both ecological and ethnobotanical contexts.
